column2: JMM, 35-44 Female  on Treatment for 1 to less than 2 years (Patient)
column9: I am a 37 year old female who used 1 mil of minoxdill 5% twice a day for a year. During this time, my hair texture drastically improved and my hair was able to grow past my shoulders. I still was experiencing a decrease in the frontal hairline, however, but was satisfied with results at that time. Due to a trip, I interrupted use of this product for a week and upon continuing use, I experienced a burning sensation on my scalp that became painful and miserable so I discontinued treatment. Also, during this year, I experienced unexplained symptoms that happened only when I started my period, as I will explain below, but did not relate this to minoxdil until now.After being off this product for 6 months, I lost all the beautiful hair I had from the previous year but had normal periods during this duration.  However, since my hair loss was becoming more and more apparent, I decided to return to treatment. This time I began using minoxdill 4.5% and decided that I would only use 1 mil, once per day in the evening. After using this product for three weeks it was time for my period again which happened unusually late, starting at 32 days instead of the normal 28. And just as when using minoxdil previously, as I began to start my period, I felt dizzy, faint, nauseous, grew pale, felt an incredible urge to use the restroom multiple times, felt incredibly hot, profusely sweated, then got really cold, felt weak and had to lay on the bathroom floor to recover. The whole episode lasted around 45 minutes and then after resting briefly I felt fine again. This scary experience has happen regularly while using minoxdil.
